result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven J Herod

records.addlTxt:
10:34 AM Defendant Steven J Herod in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Steven J Herod.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Randy Sitzberger sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Pitzo.  

Defense requests a preliminary hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:
ADA Randy Sitzberger sworn in and testified on direct by Attorney Pitzo.  
Cross examination by attorney Wang.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prior: 2601 MacArthur Road, C17, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:05 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Steven J Herod in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Steven J Herod. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Wang is appointed. 
Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
